info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Jones, southeastern Lenoir and northwestern Craven Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 651 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Deep Run, or 10 miles south of Kinston, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Bern, Kinston, River Bend, Phillips Crossroads, Deep Run, Fort Barnwell, Jasper, Tuscarora, Rhems, Pleasant Hill, Wyse Fork, Dover, Sandy Bottom, Cove City, Pollocksville and Trenton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
